c79edef3-56cf-4723-9956-346abf1c795e.description: Earners of this badge have completed a year long project based on an area of their own choice. With the assistance of a facilitator they have designed, developed and completed a project of personal significance.
c79edef3-56cf-4723-9956-346abf1c795e.name: Passion Project

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have identified an area of passion and have chosen to complete a project based on their area of interest. They initially plan the project and set goals to achieve the desired result. The projects can vary depending on the individual student and in the past have been musical releases, live performances, technical products, services and other creative endeavours.

55bb8e5c-4c0f-49f3-befd-d3c714478956.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated their skills in making art using different mediums during a Visual Art course at MIC. They have curated a portfolio and received feedback from their teacher/mentor.
55bb8e5c-4c0f-49f3-befd-d3c714478956.name: Visual Art Portfolio I

alignments.name: QCAA Arts Syllabuses

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have successfully curated a portfolio of their artwork highlighting the skills they used over the course of the creative courses at MIC. Earners also include art making journals and reflective documents in the portfolio.

81d28bad-b51b-48a8-820a-4db0ec5d2359.description: Earners of the Live Music Event Management I badge have demonstrated that they can identify and use essential business and management skills required to be a successful event manager through the development and operation of an in house music event.
81d28bad-b51b-48a8-820a-4db0ec5d2359.name: Live Music Event Management I

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a ten week course on live music event management.
Earners develop and operate a live music event onsite at Music Industry College for students of the college.

4c44ebff-6b6a-4b5e-a1da-e95e728ef640.description: The MIC Pillars Award is presented to students who have embraced the pillars of MIC in all areas inside and outside the classroom over the past twelve months. The four pillars of MIC are, Trust, Respect, Participation and Community.
4c44ebff-6b6a-4b5e-a1da-e95e728ef640.name: MIC Pillars Award

badge_template_activities.title: In order to receive this award students must be nominated by at least three MIC staff.

1117af4a-232c-4d46-a93a-886021928964.description: Earners of the Writing For The Internet badge have a fundamental understanding of specific features for Internet sites. They know and demonstrate the correct usage of these features for news and opinion articles.
1117af4a-232c-4d46-a93a-886021928964.name: Writing for the Internet I

alignments.name: Completion of assessment for Unit 1 and/or Unit 3 of General English, QCAA
alignments.description: Students complete and pass a required assessment for Unit 1 and/or internal assessment 1 for Unit 3, based on QCAA standards.

badge_template_activities.title: Include structural features of Internet articles such as: A headline, lede and byline; audio or visuals or hyperlinks to similar topics or to attribute sources; short paragraphs to fit the one column format of Internet articles
Write an article or series of articles for the school blog Starving Kids, including altering the copy based on editorial advice.

1c6dc859-30c8-4599-80f1-913c6ac079d8.description: The earner of the Music Industry College Animation I badge has demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities that form the foundation for the development of basic animations. They have used a range of Adobe Creative Cloud applications to develop animations for a variety of purposes.
1c6dc859-30c8-4599-80f1-913c6ac079d8.name: Animation I

alignments.name: QCAA Media Arts in Practice syllabus

badge_template_activities.title: Earners participate in a 12 week course of face-2-face sessions. Validated by a registered teacher.
Earners produce a portfolio of animations fit for purpose. Validated by a registered teacher.

b4ed9be4-7349-4c73-a327-e2be2b4571e8.description: Earners of the Cinematography I badge have a fundamental understanding of digital cameras and the ability to capture moving images for a specific purpose. They know and demonstrated the correct application of the principal techniques of cinematography. These candidates are able to create and edit a moving image sequence.
b4ed9be4-7349-4c73-a327-e2be2b4571e8.name: Cinematography I

alignments.name: QCAA Unit 1 Film and Television and New Media
QCAA Unit 3 Media Arts in Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Complete camera skill training

skills.name: Eye for detail, Understand lighting techniques, Technical knowledge of cameras

b6999274-a968-4d15-ae84-93f14147b243.description: Earners of the Writing For The Internet badge have a fundamental understanding of specific features of short stories. They know and demonstrate the correct usage of these features for writing short stories by creating effective representations in imaginative works, displaying an understanding of patterns and conventions of narrative short stories and in language choices for the genre.
b6999274-a968-4d15-ae84-93f14147b243.name: Creative Writing - Short Stories II

alignments.name: Completion of assessment for Unit 2 and Unit 4 of General English, QCAA
alignments.description: Students complete and pass a required assessment for Unit 2 and/or internal assessment 3 for Unit 4, based on QCAA standards.

alignments.name: Students complete the short story course
alignments.description: Students complete all work in the short story course on Creating Memorable Characters in Short Fiction

badge_template_activities.title: Students will have completed a course on creating memorable characters in short fiction.
Students have written a short story which includes the creation of characters, writing in descriptive prose and dialogue and using the elements of narrative structure to tell a story.

ae8dff41-a676-482d-b37a-4d34fde21c04.description: Earners construct, perform and film a presentation that is created for a specific purpose and audience. They independently manipulate various modes to enhance the presentation, film themselves and upload it to a digital platform for an online audience.
ae8dff41-a676-482d-b37a-4d34fde21c04.name: Presenting for a purpose I

badge_template_activities.title: Manipulation of digital media for specific purpose. Ability to construct and present content for a specific audience. Ability to film and upload work to digital platforms.

41a6054e-819d-4149-87e2-c7009018eca4.description: The earner of the Music Industry College Brand Development I badge has demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities that form the foundation for the development of a personal brand. The individual can identify and clearly define a brand strategy and its value proposition; is solutions-oriented; and demonstrates an ability to articulate a concept or idea to potential clients. They have used a range of Adobe Creative Cloud applications to develop logos and other branding elements.
41a6054e-819d-4149-87e2-c7009018eca4.name: Brand Development I

alignments.name: QCAA Media Arts in Practice Syllabus

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a 12 week course of face-2-face lessons.
Earners complete a design and branding brief that shows understanding of the ‘product’ and the intended audience. 700 words

Earners produce a portfolio of designs including a band logo and a range of promotional products (eg. t-shirts, coasters, posters & flyers) based on the brand identity developed in the project assessment.

e355adc0-d933-43bc-9e8a-8cf6fad0a801.description: Earners of the Music Industry College Business Plan badge have demonstrated that they can identify essential business and management skills required to be a successful entrepreneur, identify a sustainable business niche after conducting market research, create an origin story, conduct and evaluate industry research, create a basic business plan with cost and revenue projections, and present business concepts and receive feedback on them.
e355adc0-d933-43bc-9e8a-8cf6fad0a801.name: Business Planning I

alignments.name: QCAA Business Studies Syllabus
alignments.description: Music Industry College is an accredited independent non-state school that delivers courses designed to fulfil the requirements of national and state based syllabuses.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete the ten week course of face-2-face learning.
Submit folio of evidence including business plan, project roadmap, budget, industry research report and business communication documents assessed by a registered teacher.

bbf04126-4f0d-429a-9fb2-2c5609e87b34.description: Earners of the Adobe Illustrator Level 1 have fundamental understanding of the Illustrator application and the ability to complete tasks independently. They know and have demonstrated the correct application of the basic features of Adobe Illustrator. These candidates are able to create and edit a digital image for a variety of purposes and situations.
bbf04126-4f0d-429a-9fb2-2c5609e87b34.name: Adobe Illustrator I

alignments.name: QCAA Media in Practice Unit 1

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required Adobe Illustrator training including several helpx.adobe.com tutorials for animation.

d84495d0-09a3-4937-8bf2-4ca76959b56e.description: Live Music Performance badges recognise students who have pursued the development of their instrumental and/or vocal performance skills. Earners of this badge have performed at multiple open mic events and/or busking, in addition to the performances required for their music subjects.
d84495d0-09a3-4937-8bf2-4ca76959b56e.name: Live Music Performance I

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher verifies the range and standard of performances completed by the badge earner.

c426bcfb-6047-45e0-9baf-671c2d5f2dd0.description: Earners of the Music Industry College Project Management I badge have demonstrated that they can identify essential business and management skills required to successfully manage a project from concept to completion. The product they have developed through this process is now ready to be released to the market.
c426bcfb-6047-45e0-9baf-671c2d5f2dd0.name: Project Management I

alignments.name: QCAA Business Studies Syllabus

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed a ten week face-2-face course in Project Management
Successful completion of a project management report and reflective document.
Completion of a Project Management portfolio containing initial project brainstorming document, project plan, project charter, project roadmap, budget and checklist.

254fdc93-aa42-454b-ba44-8a3a958b37a3.description: Earners of the Adobe Photoshop Level 1 have fundamental understanding of the Photoshop application and the ability to complete tasks independently. They know and have demonstrate the correct application of the basic features of Adobe Photoshop. These candidates are able to create and edit a digital image for a variety of purposes and situations.
254fdc93-aa42-454b-ba44-8a3a958b37a3.name: Adobe Photoshop I

alignments.name: QCAA Unit 1 Media

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required Adobe Photoshop 2022 - training
Complete a portfolio of ten digital images produced in Photoshop 2022

skills.name: Adobe Photoshop 2022, Photo manipulation, Typography, Masks and Channels, Correcting Images, Masks and Channels, Filters, Blending Modes, Smart Layers, Wrap text, Sharpening, Feather & Hide Selections, Blur Tool, Content Aware Tool.

540485cd-b829-4827-b5ec-673856f70acf.description: Earners of the Music Industry College Music Media Marketing badge have identified and applied the essential marketing techniques and theories that are required to successfully gain media coverage, radio play and adds to streaming playlists. Earners develop a marketing strategy that includes relevant assets that include promotional photos, artist bio, press release and a finished song ready for release.
540485cd-b829-4827-b5ec-673856f70acf.name: Music Media Marketing

alignments.name: QCAA Business Studies syllabus
alignments.description: Music Industry College is an accredited independent non-state school that delivers courses designed to fulfil the requirements of national and state based syllabuses.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will complete a 12 week face-to-face course totalling 27 hours.
Students will pitch a multi-modal presentation of their marketing plan to an independent assessor.

8732dd7f-2ac1-4f4b-b2b2-5acbe09e9a6e.description: Earners of this award have embraced the pillars of MIC, trust, respect, community and participation, in all areas inside and outside the classroom over the past two years. They have completed the requirements of the Queensland Certificate of education. Engaged consistently in extra-curricular activities and completed a passion project to a high standard. The MIC Honour Award is the highest achievement a student can reach at Music Industry College.
8732dd7f-2ac1-4f4b-b2b2-5acbe09e9a6e.name: MIC Honour Award

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must fulfil the following criteria: 1. Achieve a Pillars Award; 2. Achieve their QCE; 3. Achieve a Passion Project Badge; 4. Engage consistently in an extra-curricular activity.

24c5fcc6-ea34-42a8-bd94-52bb91b74f9a.description: Earners construct, perform a presentation that is created for a specific purpose and audience. This includes using widely-used methods of rhetoric, identifying language suitable to their audience and the structure and aesthetics of speech writing, as well as in their use of voice and body language.
24c5fcc6-ea34-42a8-bd94-52bb91b74f9a.name: Presenting For A Purpose II

alignments.name: Completion of a speech using a discerning level of the skills required
alignments.description: Students complete and receive a very high achievement in this task.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will have completed a unit of work aimed at analysing media representations of particular social groups and learning how to write about them
Students will have completed a speech in front of their peers outlining their analysis and delivering a thesis and supporting argument in spoken form.

1fe5ad2b-17c0-449c-a361-08309269e4b3.description: Earners of this badge know and understand the policy and procedures for child safety at Music Industry College. They know and understand how it applies to the staff code of conduct policy.
1fe5ad2b-17c0-449c-a361-08309269e4b3.name: Child Safety

alignments.name: Music Industry College Student Protection Policy
Music Industry College Student Protection Procedure

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed the Child Safety and Staff Code of Conduct professional development.

ea08af3d-2480-452b-997c-df03564e9512.description: The earner of this award has to deliver a high quality live music performance to an external audience.
ea08af3d-2480-452b-997c-df03564e9512.name: Live Performance of the Year

badge_template_activities.title: Earners perform live to an audience that is external to Music Industry College. The award is given to the student/s who, in the opinion of our Music teachers, gave the best musical performance in the calendar year.

52f18a9c-35f0-430b-9356-9db2d8bf804d.description: Earners of this badge have pursued the development of their skills in the area of songwriting/ composition. They have composed at least three complete works, in any musical genre and have created audio demos or scores for each piece.
52f18a9c-35f0-430b-9356-9db2d8bf804d.name: Music Composition I

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have pursued the development of their skills in the area of songwriting/ composition. This could be through formal courses, songwriting clubs, mentoring or self education.
Earners have composed at least three complete works, in any musical genre and have created audio demos or scores for each piece.

0475866c-113b-44ca-a201-b5b494eb9c68.description: Earners of the Writing For The Internet II badge have a fundamental understanding of the audience of Internet sites that publish literary/entertainment essays and opinion pieces. They know and have demonstrated suitable patterns and conventions of Internet articles, as well as suitable language choices and written features on topics that interest and entertain that audience.
0475866c-113b-44ca-a201-b5b494eb9c68.name: Writing For The Internet II

alignments.name: https://www.qcaa.qld.edu.au/downloads/portal/ismg_english_ia1.pdf
alignments.description: Students complete a required assessment effectively for Unit 1 and/or internal assessment 1 for Unit 3, based on QCAA standards

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete assessment for either Unit 1 of Unit 3 General English. Verified by a registered teacher. Their work will display an understanding of audience by using language that is suitable for personal essays in a style more suited to thoughtful exploration of texts with pop culture references and for the modern internet opinion articles.

Earners complete assessment with an effective understanding of this style of writing for the school blog Starving Kids. Verified by a registered teacher. Their work will display an understanding of audience by using language that is suitable for personal essays in a style more suited to thoughtful exploration of texts with pop culture references and for the modern internet opinion articles.

skills.name: Adapt And Adopt Appropriate Style To Audience
Proficiency In Using Word Processing Software

22648a75-f5b9-4c97-b6d5-12cc20cbae40.description: Live Music Performance badges recognise students who have pursued the development of their instrumental and/or vocal performance skills. Earners of this badge have performed at multiple events at a range of venues, including full sets of music, in addition to the performances required for their music subjects.
22648a75-f5b9-4c97-b6d5-12cc20cbae40.name: Live Music Performance II

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher verifies the range and standard of performances completed by the badge earner.

e874bf3d-d500-4b23-849f-9070666e5389.description: Earners construct, perform and film a presentation that is created for a specific purpose and audience. They independently manipulate various modes to enhance the presentation, film themselves and upload it to a digital platform for an online audience. This includes using widely-used methods of rhetoric, identifying language suitable to their audience and the structure and aesthetics of speech writing, as well as in their use of voice and body language.
e874bf3d-d500-4b23-849f-9070666e5389.name: Presenting For A Purpose III

alignments.name: Completion of assessment for Unit 4 of General English, QCAA
alignments.description: Students complete and receive a very high achievement in this task.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will complete a unit of study including methods of rhetoric and speech delivery. This involves choosing an important world topic in the news and providing a solution and call to action to the problem.

Students must deliver a speech and then manipulate digital media for specific purpose. Ability to construct and present content for a specific audience. Ability to film and upload work to digital platforms.

122d9273-84b2-455a-af36-b61a2f6e35a1.description: Earners of the Radio Announcer badge have demonstrated an understanding of the fundamental skills required to produce a pre-recorded program for radio. Topics covered include : Understanding the Australian Codes of Practice, what makes good radio, developing a unique program and persona, microphone techniques, using recording and editing software, Interviewing techniques, understanding AMRAP (Australian Music Radio Airplay project).
122d9273-84b2-455a-af36-b61a2f6e35a1.name: Radio Announcer I

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will use an audio-software program of their choice (Logic-Pro/Audacity/REAPER) to produce a pre-recorded radio show of one hour duration. It will contain announcing, back-announcing, one interview and music tracks. The program would be of broadcast quality and suitable for a Youth Program on a Community Broadcaster.

7710743c-ac87-46fc-a17c-38e75ed81a80.description: Earners of the Writing For The Internet 3 badge have written work that is structured appropriately for Internet audiences of literary opinion articles/blogs, have written their work to appeal to that audience and also have the ability to analyse popular, entertainment and/or literary texts in a way that provides insight to audiences.
7710743c-ac87-46fc-a17c-38e75ed81a80.name: Writing For The Internet III

alignments.name: Effective Demonstration of QCAA standards for General English

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this certificate display effective analysis in texts of perspectives and representations of concepts, identities, times and places; cultural assumptions, attitudes, values and beliefs underpin the texts and invite audiences to take up positions; the effects of aesthetic features and stylistic devices in the texts. Their work is entertaining and insightful in a way that appeals to an audience.

Earners of this certificate display effective analysis in texts of perspectives and representations of concepts, identities, times and places; cultural assumptions, attitudes, values and beliefs underpin the texts and invite audiences to take up positions; the effects of aesthetic features and stylistic devices in the texts. Their work is entertaining and insightful in a way that appeals to the audience of the school's Starving Kids blog.

skills.name: Proficiency In Using Word Processing Software

8e8c3096-b1a4-4da8-aa3d-149e7554d599.description: Earners of the Community Builder badge coordinate various activities and fundraisers which enhance the sense of Community both within and outside Music Industry College.
8e8c3096-b1a4-4da8-aa3d-149e7554d599.name: Community Builder

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance (80% or greater) of meetings in a 12 month period.
Organisation of at least 2 events presented by Joy Division (MIC Community Builder extra-curricular activity)

be7938ff-ae5d-4028-b75d-06e5cd2c25b1.description: Earners of the Writing For The Internet badge have a fundamental understanding of specific features of short stories. They know and demonstrate the correct usage of these features for writing short stories by creating subtle and complex representations in imaginative works, displaying a highly effective understanding of the patterns and conventions of narrative short stories and in discerning language choices for the genre.
be7938ff-ae5d-4028-b75d-06e5cd2c25b1.name: Creative Writing - Short Stories III

alignments.name: Students complete the short story course
alignments.description: Students complete all work in the short story course on Creating Memorable Characters in Short Fiction

badge_template_activities.title: Students will have completed a course on creating memorable characters in short fiction.
Students have written a short story which includes the creation of characters, writing in descriptive prose and dialogue and using the elements of narrative structure to tell a story.

adda978b-7845-4135-a07e-af2b4cd6c913.description: Earners of the Maths Club badge have been regular attendees at the weekly tuition offered at Music Industry College outside of regular school hours. Attendance at Maths Club is voluntary, and demonstrates a student's commitment to improving their confidence and outcomes in their Maths results.
adda978b-7845-4135-a07e-af2b4cd6c913.name: Maths Club

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at 80% or more Maths Club sessions in one calender year

b2300c08-bb16-4e4d-a725-d1707e7a2a73.description: Earners of the Writing For The Internet badge have a fundamental understanding of specific features of short stories. They know and demonstrate the correct usage of these features for writing short stories.
b2300c08-bb16-4e4d-a725-d1707e7a2a73.name: Creative Writing - Short Stories I

alignments.name: Completion of assessment for Unit 2 and Unit 4 of General English, QCAA
alignments.description: Students complete and pass a required assessment for Unit 2 and/or internal assessment 3 for Unit 4, based on QCAA standards.

alignments.name: Students complete the short story course
alignments.description: Students complete all work in the short story course on Creating Memorable Characters in Short Fiction

badge_template_activities.title: Students will have completed a course on creating memorable characters in short fiction.
Students have written a short story which includes the creation of characters, writing in descriptive prose and dialogue and using the elements of narrative structure to tell a story.

7ba0e8ef-c93b-4e98-9ff4-be7b881eacbb.description: Earners of the Music Industry College Entrepreneurship badge demonstrate a foundational understanding of entrepreneurial concepts required to launch a new business, product, or service. This includes decision making, entrepreneurship skills, using tools and models for business, context analysis, planning, and social impact. This badge is designed for new business owners, individuals wanting to grow a business already launched, or learners interested in entrepreneurship.
7ba0e8ef-c93b-4e98-9ff4-be7b881eacbb.name: Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must have designed, developed and launched an entrepreneurial business or project to the general public. The business or project must be profitable before this badge will be issued. The project must have a public benefit and be sustainable beyond graduation.

db8dec3f-2a1a-4b31-a93a-f323ae49b0fb.description: Earners of the Live Music Event Management II badge have demonstrated that they can identify and use essential business and management skills required to be a successful event manager through the development and operation of a live music event for the general public.
db8dec3f-2a1a-4b31-a93a-f323ae49b0fb.name: Live Music Event Management II

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete a ten week course on live music event management.

Earners will curate a live music event at a venue outside of music industry college for the general public. They are required to book the venue and the performers. They are required to develop a marketing plan for the event and actively market the event.

e62d616a-31f5-4cd7-bb07-fcd4c1cf33a6.description: Earners of this badge have pursued the development of their skills in the area of songwriting/ composition. They have composed at least three complete works, in any genre and have created high quality audio demos or scores for each piece. These pieces should demonstrate a variety of stylistic traits with one piece being a collaboration with another songwriter/ producer. The earner has produced one or more polished recordings that have been released to a public platform and registered with APRA.
e62d616a-31f5-4cd7-bb07-fcd4c1cf33a6.name: Music Composition III

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have pursued the development of their skills in the area of songwriting/ composition. This could be through formal courses, workshops, songwriting clubs, mentoring or self education.
Earners have composed at least three complete works, in any musical genre. These pieces should demonstrate a variety of stylistic traits.
The earner has collaborated with another songwriter/ producer.
The earner has created high quality audio demos or scores for each piece.
The earner has produced one or more polished recordings that have been released to a public platform and registered with the Australasian Performing Right Association (APRA).

ace591a3-d1e7-4b7c-bb1a-ab1cb205de1e.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities that form the foundational understanding of the exposure triangle and rules of composition for photography. The individual can manipulate the manual settings of an analogue camera to produce correctly exposed and composed photographs.
ace591a3-d1e7-4b7c-bb1a-ab1cb205de1e.name: Analogue Photography I

badge_template_activities.title: The earner submits a portfolio of ten photographs that are correctly exposed and obey the rules of composition.

be2e6ab4-363b-4b42-82d6-fde9d0863d80.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities that form the foundational understanding of film development. They can successfully transfer film to Paterson tanks in preparation for development. The individual can correctly mix chemicals and complete the development of black and white film and C41 film types.
be2e6ab4-363b-4b42-82d6-fde9d0863d80.name: Analogue Photography II

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a four hour course on film development.
Earners successfully develop four rolls of black and white film and four rolls of C41 film types. Verified by a registered teacher.

e11c8711-8da9-4ed0-afb5-b6869d66c6da.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities that lead to the curation of a photography exhibition and/or production of a photography book. The individual can capture an image worthy of the public eye, develop their own film, scan, edit and digitise their work. They can edit their work to prepare for public viewing.
e11c8711-8da9-4ed0-afb5-b6869d66c6da.name: Analogue Photography III

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has developed a portfolio of work consisting of no fewer than 100 photographs.
The earner curates an exhibition and/or book of their own personal work for the general public. The exhibition contains no fewer than 12 images, the book contains no fewer than 36 images.

410182f6-f411-4d8c-991d-0e640e781efc.description: Live Music Performance badges recognise students who have pursued the development of their instrumental and/or vocal performance skills. Earners of this badge are seasoned performers who have given public performances on a consistent basis at a range of venues, typically in a professional or semi-professional setting.
410182f6-f411-4d8c-991d-0e640e781efc.name: Live Music Performance III

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher verifies the range and standard of performances completed by the badge earner.

8b9e0b14-397c-499c-8b2c-72c2e425461a.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate independent use of Logic Pro to an advanced level, including the use of bussing, the creation of sounds in synthesiser plugins such as Retrosynth and the creation of custom settings in effects plugins such as Space Designer, Chromaverb and Delay Designer.
8b9e0b14-397c-499c-8b2c-72c2e425461a.name: Logic Pro II

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the independent and effective use of the digital audio workstation Logic Pro for music production to the level specified.

91730459-0224-439a-9209-625d746eec68.description: The All-Rounder award is presented to a student who shows excellence across all areas of schooling including academic, attitude, personal conduct, leadership and participation in school and community events.
91730459-0224-439a-9209-625d746eec68.name: MIC All Rounder Award

badge_template_activities.title: The entire MIC staff are involved in the allocation of this award.

872ffd52-1e2a-4775-9a07-a19d98205bb3.description: Earners of this badge have pursued the development of their skills in the area of songwriting/ composition. They have composed at least three complete works, in any genre and have created audio demos or scores for each piece. These pieces should demonstrate a variety of stylistic traits. The earner has produced a polished recording of at least one composition.
872ffd52-1e2a-4775-9a07-a19d98205bb3.name: Music Composition II

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have pursued the development of their skills in the area of songwriting/ composition. This could be through formal courses, workshops, songwriting clubs, mentoring or self education.
Earners have composed at least three complete works, in any musical genre and have created audio demos or scores for each piece. These pieces should demonstrate a variety of stylistic traits.
The earner has produced a polished recording of at least one composition.

ea2c52e1-e291-4be3-84a8-64ea02b8c53f.description: Earners of this badge have regularly attended sessions in which they learned soldering and the building of electronics devices from kits using printed circuit boards, resistors, capacitors, integrated circuits and other electronics components. Devices may include guitar effects pedals, microphones, direct boxes, microphone preamplifiers, studio compressors & equalisers, and instrument cables.
ea2c52e1-e291-4be3-84a8-64ea02b8c53f.name: Soldering & Electronics

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has built, tested and troubleshooted at least one complete and functional electronic device from the list in the description.

c3607b64-7044-4ebe-9581-263915712edc.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate competent use of a one-room recording studio to record high-quality audio tracks simultaneously from multiple sound sources using microphones and/or DIs.
c3607b64-7044-4ebe-9581-263915712edc.name: Studio Audio Engineering II

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the correct set up and operation of audio interface, speakers, microphones and Direct Inputs. Set gain staging and phantom power suitably for source. Record high-quality audio successfully from multiple sources, such as a mic'd drum kit or acoustic duo.

2c995729-fd4a-42cd-8e28-48db705daa10.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate competent use of a two-room recording studio to record high-quality audio tracks simultaneously from multiple sound sources using microphones and/or DIs.
2c995729-fd4a-42cd-8e28-48db705daa10.name: Studio Audio Engineering III

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the correct set up and operation of a two-room recording studio, including: audio interface, speakers, headphone amplifier, microphones, microphone preamplifier, hardware compression and/or EQ, and Direct Inputs. Selection and positioning of microphones appropriately for source. Set gain staging and phantom power suitably for source. Record high-quality audio successfully from multiple sources, such as a full band.

dbf6f53e-698f-47ce-bde4-e3ec3ceaad46.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate independent use of Ableton Live to an advanced level, including the use of groups, use of sends and returns, use of the drum rack, automation and use of dynamics processing on the master channel.
dbf6f53e-698f-47ce-bde4-e3ec3ceaad46.name: Ableton Live II

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the independent and effective use of the digital audio workstation Ableton Live for music production to the level specified.

6abdfff6-a6ea-4b38-ae02-0f1acb80c9e4.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate independent use of Ableton Live to an expert level, including warping audio, using the software for a live performance, use of Max for Live, use of side-chain compression.
6abdfff6-a6ea-4b38-ae02-0f1acb80c9e4.name: Ableton Live III

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the independent and effective use of the digital audio workstation Ableton Live for music production to the level specified.

fbe19d9e-d118-435c-940c-a14718648c20.description: Earners of the Adobe Photoshop Level II to develop the skills and understanding necessary to manage, composite and edit photos. Students will learn how to adjust color, add and use layers, apply filters for different effects, dodge and burn, gradients, and select and manipulate sections of images
fbe19d9e-d118-435c-940c-a14718648c20.name: Adobe Photoshop II

alignments.name: QCAA Unit 1 Media

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required Adobe Photoshop 2022 - training
Complete a portfolio of ten digital images produced in Photoshop 2022

skills.name: Adobe Photoshop 2022, Photo manipulation, Typography, Masks and Channels, Correcting Images, Masks and Channels, Filters, Blending Modes, Smart Layers, Wrap text, Sharpening, Feather & Hide Selections, Blur Tool, Content Aware Tool.

22fae953-85f5-42e0-b638-1bb167742c58.description: Earners of the Live Music Event Management III badge have demonstrated that they can identify and use essential business and management skills required to be a successful event manager. They develop, coordinate and operate live music events during their graduate year.
22fae953-85f5-42e0-b638-1bb167742c58.name: Live Music Event Management III

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete a ten week live music event management course.
Earners must achieve badges Event Management I and II as pre-requisites experiences.

Earners must develop and produce no fewer than three live music events in a calendar year. All of the events must be booked at venues external to Music Industry College. Earners must also work collaboratively with a team to ensure effective operation of the events. The events must comply with local by-laws and regulations.

skills.name: Enterprise Risk Management / Financial Risk Management

d9e23b08-fb1e-4031-b2d5-42adc58f940c.description: The Industry Award is given to a graduating in recognition of the potential for further success in the music industry based on the work, effort and achievements that a student has achieved in their two years at MIC.
d9e23b08-fb1e-4031-b2d5-42adc58f940c.name: MIC Industry Award

badge_template_activities.title: This award is based on the music industry experiences of the selected graduate over a period of two years at Music Industry College. These experiences include but are not limited to, song releases, live performances, radio play, music streams, industry connections, media commitments, music business creation.

b7e236de-2596-48ec-96e5-2f764fb9ef0b.description: The earner of the True Grit award demonstrates the ability to strive to achieve their best despite facing obstacles that at times seem insurmountable.
b7e236de-2596-48ec-96e5-2f764fb9ef0b.name: MIC True Grit Award

badge_template_activities.title: The entire staff of MIC are involved in the selection of the recipient of this award.

5bee8240-efb4-49a4-a165-72fc8d05e7ba.description: Earners of the spreadsheets badge have a fundamental understanding of spreadsheets. They know and demonstrate the correct application of key features of spreadsheets. These candidates are able to create and edit a workbook and use basic functions.
5bee8240-efb4-49a4-a165-72fc8d05e7ba.name: Spreadsheets I

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holder can enter and format data, create charts and use formulas within a spreadsheet.

995b1a3e-1744-41e2-8722-d2169b7ea592.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate independent use of Ableton Live to record, edit, and mix audio, plus the use of software instruments and other plugins to produce music.
995b1a3e-1744-41e2-8722-d2169b7ea592.name: Ableton Live I

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the independent and effective use of the digital audio workstation Ableton Live for music production to the level specified.

793a6c1e-cea3-4e9a-9b87-facb88d63334.description: Earners of the Bloom Festival badge have used their knowledge, skills and business acumen to work collaboratively with a team of peers to design, develop and operate Bloom Festival.
793a6c1e-cea3-4e9a-9b87-facb88d63334.name: Bloom Festival

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a ten week course on event management.
Earners apply to local council to secure a grant for the festival.

Earners plan and curate an artist line up that will attract a capacity audience to a local music venue. They develop a budget for the event, manage costs and maximise income. Earners communicate with booking agents to secure the talent. Develop worksheets and agreements to be distributed to venue, artists and management. Operate the festival in a professional manner that ensures the safety of the patrons. Debrief and analyse the festival to make recommendations for future Bloom Festivals.

aa96695d-47d6-4b4e-b801-157f9791aa5f.description: Earners of the Cinematography II badge have demonstrated video production and post-production skills for film-making including, shot-listing, storyboarding, basic cinematography, sound recording, and non-linear editing. They have demonstrated the ability to use portable and studio equipment to produce original video works, and a fundamental understanding of the camera technology, theory and terminology
aa96695d-47d6-4b4e-b801-157f9791aa5f.name: Cinematography II

alignments.name: Unit 2 Film and Television and New Media QCAA
alignments.description: Unit 2 Film and Television and New Media QCAA

alignments.name: Unit 3 Media in Practice QCAA

badge_template_activities.title: Complete formative assessment criteria for foundation project and experimental music video
Generate portfolio of works

skills.name: Moodboarding, Storyboarding, Shoot from storyboard, Record atmosphere tracks, Import/backup rushes, Organise and sort folders, Generate titles

07c85f66-e80b-4661-adfd-e062987df834.description: Earners of the Cinematography III badge can produce rendered cinematic projects. They have access to valuable assets, tools, and practices that are critical to creating work of high quality. The student understands lighting, camera settings and colour-grading. They use compositional, storyboarding and mood-boarding techniques to create a project. The student is knowledgeable on camera technology, theory and terminology and can and edit title sequences from scratch.
07c85f66-e80b-4661-adfd-e062987df834.name: Cinematography III

alignments.name: Unit 4 Film and Television
New Media QCAA Unit 4 Media in Practice QCAA

badge_template_activities.title: Complete summative internal assessment criteria for foundation project and stylistic project
Complete media Unit 4 - internal assessment 4: Careers in the Media

skills.name: Automated dialog replacement, Sound foley, Colour grading, Creative lighting, Asset creation, Portfolio building

0344a4a9-dc28-4e7a-b5dd-930d32023db0.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate independent use of Logic Pro to record, edit, and mix audio, plus the use of software instruments and other plugins to produce music.
0344a4a9-dc28-4e7a-b5dd-930d32023db0.name: Logic Pro I

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the independent and effective use of the digital audio workstation Logic Pro for music production to the level specified.

64d526b2-6e09-4fe2-b5b9-0d45342cd4a4.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate independent use of Logic Pro at an expert level, including the creation of custom sampled instruments in Sampler, advanced use of Alchemy, use of flex pitch and flex time.
64d526b2-6e09-4fe2-b5b9-0d45342cd4a4.name: Logic Pro III

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the independent and effective use of the digital audio workstation Logic Pro for music production to the level specified.

ca856574-5125-4ec2-ac2e-3a215574ff9d.description: Earners of this award have to compose, record and submit a song to a panel of industry judges. Judges include, John Collins (Powderfinger), Maggie Collins (Morning Belle Management) and Stephen Green (SGC Media).
ca856574-5125-4ec2-ac2e-3a215574ff9d.name: MIC Song of the Year

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must receive sufficient votes across the following criteria to receive this award; music composition; lyrics; and industry readiness.

d2ee7325-c02f-4036-8df8-4558cb768697.description: This badge earner has achieved an understanding of various mindfulness concepts and techniques, and has learned how to apply mindfulness practices to various situations. The individual understands how to further develop focus and self-awareness to respond to stress and foster wellbeing and resilience.
d2ee7325-c02f-4036-8df8-4558cb768697.name: Mindfulness

badge_template_activities.title: - Attend 80% of sessions throughout the semester - Answer two questions in a reflective statement: 1) What did you find most helpful from taking this program? 2) What aspects will you incorporate into your wellness practice?

skills.name: awareness of breath and body sensation
fostering loving kindness and self compassion

13e461a1-d7be-4629-8402-3786cce25996.description: Earners of the Practical Philosophy certifcation have been introduced to the world's great philosophical teachings, and have been exposed to many practical disciplines as a way of accessing a better understanding of themselves and the world in which they live. They have explored different states of awareness; learned the value of considered decision-making, and have applied Plato's practical teachings in living a Just life.
13e461a1-d7be-4629-8402-3786cce25996.name: Practical Wisdom I

alignments.name: School of Practical Philosophy's introductory course 'The Wisdom Within'
alignments.description: The School of Practical Philosophy is a not-for-profit, volunteer organisation. Except for a small, administrative staff, all work and tuition in the School is undertaken on an unpaid, voluntary basis.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 20-week Practical Philosophy course 'The Wisdom Within' with at least 75% attendance record.

c7bfcadd-368a-4a2b-a7f6-81d0d79a5733.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate competent use of an audio interface, computer and music software to effectively record high-quality audio from multiple sound sources using microphones and DIs.
c7bfcadd-368a-4a2b-a7f6-81d0d79a5733.name: Studio Audio Engineering I

badge_template_activities.title: Qualified teacher observes the candidate correctly set up and connect portable audio interface, headphones, microphones and/or direct input sources. Set gain staging and phantom power. Record high-quality audio successfully from several sources individually.

22832b92-2b32-4f1d-b0a3-a769d46e872a.description: Earners of the Web Design certification have developed skills to navigate; make pages and posts; add photos; and customise the appearance of a website. They are competent in creating contact forms, custom menus, photo galleries, how to add additional users and integrate social media on a website. They will learn about current web designing trends and developments, Gain an insight into web development, Build your own portfolio website.
22832b92-2b32-4f1d-b0a3-a769d46e872a.name: Web Design I

alignments.name: Unit 3 Media in Practice QCAA

badge_template_activities.title: Complete formative assessment criteria for Media U4 - IA4: Careers in the Media (create a webpage)

skills.name: contact forms, custom menus, photo galleries, integrate social media, web designing trends
